title: The EU Open Source Policy Summit 2026: Key learnings and takeaways
content: The EU Open Source Policy Summit 2026, held on 30 January in Brussels under the theme ‘Digital Sovereignty Runs on Open Source’, brought together European policymakers, industry leaders, and open source advocates to address how open technologies can deliver on Europe’s competitiveness and sovereignty ambitions as part of the EU Open Source Week. This year’s Summit also announced a key transition: the appointment of Laszlo Igneczi as OpenForum Europe‘s new Executive
creator: Nicholas Gates
sourceDescription: Open Technologies for Europe's Digital Decade

title: Connecting Europe’s Open Source Community: EU Open Source Week 2026
content:
Every year, at the end of January, the global open source and open technology community descends on Brussels, on the occasion of the FOSDEM conference. Since 2025, the EU Open Source Week has grown, including OpenForum Europe’s (OFE) flagship event: The EU Open Source Policy Summit, offering a unique opportunity to connect with policymakers, community members, businesses, civil society and developers.

OFE is proud to have been involved in many activities throughout the EU Open Source Week 2026, which featured over 35 events on the official EU Open Source Week platform. To make the week more connected than ever, OFE also launched a
creator: Clara Thébert
sourceDescription: Open Technologies for Europe's Digital Decade
